intro: Hemigraphis setosa, commonly known as silverleaf sorrel, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of the Americas. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in spikes at the ends of the stems. Hemigraphis setosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in container gardens.
